column5: I saw these floating lures on a tv ad the other day and can't remember the maker. They were a floating snake lures they were using for bass fishing. They had three colors, black, brown, and white ones. I believe they were 11" long. The guys would cast them to shore then reel back while tugging a little and it looked just like a snake swimming across the lake.  Please respond if you know what I am talking about.  Thanks, Curt
don't remember the show but is it this one?:  http://www.naturalmotionlures.com/
Exactly the ones. Thanks. Think they would work for pike or walleye?

I don't know what type of fish they work on. They work OK in hooking fishermen.  I can't remember a time I saw a fish go after a snake.  Maybe snakes are common prey down south(?)  Whats wrong with a good old Rapala or white twisty tail jig?  forrest
Do the eyes light up and blink? A flashing tail light?  gimmick designed to catch fisherman.  Try an 8 inch zoom lizard rigged with no weight, a lot cheaper.
still new to artificial lures but i would use the snake before i use the homer,marge or bart simpsons crankbaits
yee-haw!  hurry jeb, tie one of 'em buds to my line! [j/k]  seriously though,  imo its the spinners that attracts the fish not the bottlecap

Those snake lure looked amazing among those lilys! Not sure if they would work up here in canada. I think small ones would...my buddy has got some lucky craft frogs... unreal among lilys. You think Bass Pro Shops would have these snakes?
Looks like a musky bait to me!
